sentences: Today is a special day.
I am the first person to stand on Phobos, a small moon of Mars.
I stand here in my spacesuit and look up at the red planet.
Mars is so big and beautiful.
The colors are intense – red and orange light.
It is an incredible sight.

content.contentDescription: An astronaut stands with the red surface of Phobos and the red planet Mars reflected in his spacesuit visor.

sentences: But in my heart, there is also a little bit of sadness.
I will never be able to walk on Mars itself.
This mission is only for Phobos.
But I am also excited.
Phobos is a mysterious place, and I am the first to explore it.
The gravity here is very low.
I feel light and can jump high.
Every step feels strange, almost like flying.
It is fun and makes me happy.

content.contentDescription: An astronaut jumps high into the air on the rocky surface of Phobos. The sky above is full of stars.

sentences: We only have twenty days on Phobos.
The scientists and engineers have worked hard to make the trip short.
It is less dangerous that way.
I want to discover a lot in this short time.
I am also looking forward to going home.
I miss the clouds and the rain.
I imagine standing under a blue sky again and feeling the water on my skin.

content.contentDescription: An astronaut with rain and clouds in his helmet, showing his thoughts of Earth.

sentences: But now, here on Phobos, it's time for adventure.
There is so much to do.
I take my first step and begin my work.
It is a big moment – for me and for all people on Earth.

content.contentDescription: An astronaut walks purposefully across the rocky surface of Phobos, with Mars in the background.

sentences: The end
